item.title: Javascript Datatypes
item.description:
In this tutorial, I'll be specifying javascript datatypes in brief:

Data types

  1. Primitive datatype : the datatype which does not have any additional properties and method associated with it other than the value itself.
  • The following are primitive in js:
    • string (primitive)
    • number (64-bit)
    • boolean
    • undefined
  • JS evaluates an expression from left to right, therefore different sequence may produce different results.
var result = 10 + 4 + 'hello'; // [o/p]: result = 14hello
var result = 'hello' + 10 + 4; // [o/p]: result = hello104

- JS types are dynamic, they take on different value at different scope.
var x;
[o/p]: type is undefined
x = 5;
[o/p]: type is number
x = "hi";
[o/p]: type is string

2. Objects : has additional properties and methods. - Object = when we initialize with a _new_ keyword as shown below
eg: var firstName = new String("John");
var age = new Number(10);
  • Number, Boolean can also be defined as an object as seen above.
  • Array is an object type and it has various method.
